text: Now as the lame man who had been healed held onI assume that he was literally hanging on to them, perhaps their clothes—for whatever reason he did not want to be separated from them. Some 11% of the Greek manuscripts omit ‘the lame man who had been healed’ (as in NIV [the beggar], NASB, LB, TEV [the man], etc.). to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico, the one called ‘Solomon's’, really wondering.
